content:
ProjectItemInstance Class

Definition

Wraps an evaluated item for build purposes.

In this Article

[System.Diagnostics.DebuggerDisplay("{ItemType}={EvaluatedInclude} #DirectMetadata={DirectMetadataCount})")]
public class ProjectItemInstance : Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem2
Inheritance
System.Object
ProjectItemInstance

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)

Remarks

Does not store item element information, because all evaluation and verification has already been performed.

Properties

DirectMetadataCount

Gets the number of pieces of metadata on this item.

public int DirectMetadataCount { get; }
Value
Int32

Returns the number of pieces of metadata on this item.

EvaluatedInclude

Gets the evaluated Include attribute value.

public string EvaluatedInclude { get; set; }
Value
String

Returns the evaluated Include attribute value, which may be empty string.

ItemType

Gets the item type, for example "Compile".

public string ItemType { get; }
Value
String

Returns the item type, for example "Compile".

Remarks

This cannot be set, as it is used as the key into the project's items table.

Metadata

Gets an enumerator over the evaluated metadata of the item. This is a read-only collection.

public System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectMetadataInstance> Metadata { get; }
Value
IEnumerable<ProjectMetadataInstance>

Returns an enumerator over the evaluated metadata of the item.

Remarks

Does not include built-in metadata or metadata from item definitions.

To modify the metadata, use SetMetadata.

MetadataCount

Gets the number of metadata entries, including metadata inherited from item definitions.

public int MetadataCount { get; }
Value
Int32

Returns the number of metadata entries, including metadata inherited from item definitions

Remarks

Includes both custom and built-in metadata.

MetadataNames

Gets all metadata names of this item, including metadata inherited from item definitions.

public System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<string> MetadataNames { get; }
Value
ICollection<String>

Returns all metadata names of this item, including metadata inherited from item definitions.

Remarks

Includes names of built-in metadata.

Project

Gets the owning project.

public Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectInstance Project { get; }
Value
ProjectInstance

Returns the owning project.

Methods

GetMetadata(String)

Get the metadata with the given name, including metadata inherited from item definitions.

public Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectMetadataInstance GetMetadata (string name);
name
String

The name of the metadata.

Returns
ProjectMetadataInstance

Returns the metadata with the given name. Returns null if no metadata exists with that name.

Remarks

Does not include any built-in metadata.

GetMetadataValue(String)

Gets the value of the metadata with the given name, including metadata inherited from item definitions.

public string GetMetadataValue (string name);
name
String

The name of the metadata.

Returns
String

Gets the value of the metadata with the given name, including metadata inherited from item definitions. Returns an empty string if no metadata exists with that name.

Remarks

Includes built-in metadata.

To determine whether a piece of metadata is actually present but with an empty value, use HasMetadata.

HasMetadata(String)

Determines whether the metadata with the given name is defined on this item (even if its value is empty string).

public bool HasMetadata (string name);
name
String

The name of the metadata.

Returns
Boolean

Returns true if the metadata with the given name is defined on this item (even if its value is empty string); false otherwise.

Remarks

This searches built-in metadata and metadata from item definitions, because this method is used for batching, where it doesn't matter where the metadata originated.

RemoveMetadata(String)

Removes metadata with the given name.

public void RemoveMetadata (string metadataName);
metadataName
String

The metadata name.

Remarks

This method is used by TaskItem.

SetMetadata(IEnumerable<KeyValuePair<String,String>>)

Adds metadata with the given names and values. Overwrites any metadata with the same name already in the collection.

public void SetMetadata (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair<string,string>> metadataDictionary);
metadataDictionary
IEnumerable<KeyValuePair<String,String>>

The metadata to add.

SetMetadata(String,String)

Add metadata with the given name and value. Overwrites any metadata with the same name already in the collection.

public Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectMetadataInstance SetMetadata (string name, string evaluatedValue);
name
String

The name of the metadata to add.

evaluatedValue
String

The evaluated value of the metadata to add.

Returns
ProjectMetadataInstance

Returns the new metadata.

ToString()

Gets a String that represents the current item.

public override string ToString ();
Returns
String

Returns a String that represents the current item.

Explicit Interface Implementations

ITaskItem.CloneCustomMetadata()

ITaskItem implementation. Gets the collection of custom metadata.

System.Collections.IDictionary ITaskItem.CloneCustomMetadata ();
Returns
IDictionary

The collection of custom metadata.

Remarks

  • Does not include built-in metadata.

  • This method should return a clone of the metadata.

  • Writing to this dictionary should not be reflected in the underlying item.

ITaskItem.CopyMetadataTo(ITaskItem)

ITaskItem implementation. Copies the custom metadata entries to another item.

void ITaskItem.CopyMetadataTo (Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem destinationItem);
destinationItem
ITaskItem

The item to copy the metadata entries to.

Remarks

Follow the guidelines below when implementing this method.

  • Do not overwrite the ItemSpec property.

  • Do not overwrite existing metadata entries.

  • Do not copy metadata entries that do not make sense on the destination item.

ITaskItem.GetMetadata(String)

ITaskItem implementation. Gets the value of the specified metadata entry.

string ITaskItem.GetMetadata (string metadataName);
metadataName
String

The name of the metadata entry.

Returns
String

The value of the attributeName metadata.

Remarks

Should not return null if metadata is not present.

ITaskItem.ItemSpec

ITaskItem implementation. Gets or sets the item specification.

string Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem.ItemSpec { get; set; }
Returns
String

The item specification.

Remarks

The item specification is an arbitrary string. If the item represents a file on disk, the item specification will be the path of that file.

The ItemSpec for the following item declaration in a project file is File.cs. 

<ItemGroup>  
    <Compile Include="File.cs"/>  
</ItemGroup>

ITaskItem.MetadataNames

ITaskItem implementation. Gets the names of the metadata entries associated with the item.

System.Collections.ICollection Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem.MetadataNames { get; }
Returns
ICollection

The names of the metadata entries associated with the item.

ITaskItem.SetMetadata(String,String)

ITaskItem implementation. Adds or changes a custom metadata entry to the item.

void ITaskItem.SetMetadata (string metadataName, string metadataValue);
metadataName
String

Metadata name to be added or changed.

metadataValue
String

Metadata value to be added or changed.

ITaskItem2.CloneCustomMetadataEscaped()

ITaskItem2 implementation. Returns a clone of the metadata on this object. Values returned are in their original escaped form.

System.Collections.IDictionary ITaskItem2.CloneCustomMetadataEscaped ();
Returns
IDictionary

Returns the cloned metadata, with values' escaping preserved.

ITaskItem2.EvaluatedIncludeEscaped

ITaskItem2 implementation. Evaluated include value, escaped as necessary. May be empty string. Gets or sets the item include value e.g. for disk-based items this would be the file path.

string Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem2.EvaluatedIncludeEscaped { get; set; }
Returns
String

Returns the item include value.

Remarks

Taking the opportunity to fix the property name, although this doesn't make it obvious it's an improvement on ItemSpec.

ITaskItem2.GetMetadataValueEscaped(String)

ITaskItem2 implementation. Allows the values of metadata on the item to be queried.

string ITaskItem2.GetMetadataValueEscaped (string name);
name
String

The metadata to be queried.

Returns
String

Returns the escaped metadata value.

Remarks

Taking the opportunity to fix the property name, although this doesn't make it obvious it's an improvement on GetMetadata.

ITaskItem2.SetMetadataValueLiteral(String,String)

ITaskItem2 implementation. Allows a piece of custom metadata to be set on the item. Assumes that the value passed in is unescaped, and escapes the value as necessary in order to maintain its value.

void ITaskItem2.SetMetadataValueLiteral (string metadataName, string metadataValue);
metadataName
String

The metadata name.

metadataValue
String

The metadata value.

Remarks

Taking the opportunity to fix the property name, although this doesn't make it obvious it's an improvement on SetMetadata.
